title: Auto Insurance Exclusions Drivers Have To Know About!
content:

Why would an agency refuse to meet a claim? 

There are several reasons for which an agency can refuse to pay benefits for an accident. Many policies will not cover damages caused by drunk driving. Also, damages caused by "acts of God" which refers to natural phenomenons, may not be covered by a typical car insurance plan. 

When shopping for car insurance, drivers should understand that they can customize their coverage plans. For example, a policy can contain several clauses and drivers can purchase additional coverage options. A common auto insurance clause is one that pays liability damage in case the insured collides with another uninsured motorist.
